wikipedia_page.main: George Edward Larner (7 February 1875 – 4 March 1949) was an English athlete who competed mainly in the 10-mile walk. He was a multi-time Amateur Athletic Association of England champion, and won two gold medals at the 1908 Summer Olympics in London.

He competed for Great Britain in the 1908 Summer Olympics held in London, Great Britain in the 10 mile walk where he won the Silver medal behind fellow Brit George Larner.  The two of them repeated this in the 3500 metre walk giving Ernest Webb his second silver medal of the games.
*George Larner (1875–1949), British athlete who competed mainly in the 10 mile walk
